title: Strengthening Instructional Design Practical Competencies: Problem-Based E-Learning Design Process for Technology-Intensive Science Fields

context.prior_knowledge: Basic scientific theories and hands-on experience with technology applications
context.additional_context: Instructional design competency enhancement program for professionals in education/teaching/learning fields

learning_goals: Science problem-solving requiring higher-order thinking skills beyond Bloom’s Taxonomy Level 4 (analyzing, evaluating, creating)
Designing systematic processes to solve complex technical problems using the PBL (Problem-Based Learning) methodology

During a mid-term course (3 weeks), learners design ≥2 student-centered activities (project-based learning, role-play scenarios) using collaboration platforms (Google Workspace, Padlet) and simulation software (PhET, Labster), and develop an operational plan achieving ≥80% satisfaction in peer evaluation and practical implementation.
Over four weeks, learners analyze learner performance data using digital tools (Google Forms, LMS, etc.) and create an activity plan applying ≥3 customized instructional design strategies.
Periodic diagnosis and improvement of learning activity design effectiveness through formative assessment
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
